questions.question: I was taken ............................. when they told me that I had failed.
questions.description: To be taken aback is to be shocked.

questions.question: She takes ............................ her mother.
questions.description: To take after somebody is to resemble them.

questions.question: My brother tried to take ............................... my toys but I didn't let him.
questions.description: To take something away is to remove it from somebody.

questions.question: The minister refused to take ………………….. his remarks.
questions.description: To take your remarks back is to retract them.

questions.question: The court ordered the company to take ………………………. their hoardings.
questions.description: To take something down is to remove it.

questions.question: A kind woman took …………………….. the pup that was abandoned by its masters.
questions.description: To take someone in is to give home to them.

questions.question: Please take ……………………….. your shoes before entering the temple.
questions.description: To take off shoes is to remove them.

questions.question: The plane took ……………………… at the scheduled time.
questions.description: When a plane takes off, it begins to fly.

questions.question: I don’t want to take …………………….. any more work at the moment.
questions.description: To take on work is to agree to do it.

questions.question: The company is planning to take …………………………… more programmers.
questions.description: To take on people is to hire them.

questions.question: A multinational firm is going to take ………………………… our company.
questions.description: To take over a company is to gain control of it.
